text: let's mini make start with cut an egg
box enough and keep the top path bottom
and then just trim see if there's an
edge like that just so that it can sit
flat on the table this is going to be
the wall that Humpty Dumpty sits on so
near the front of the box draw a little
circle and then cut that out make this
easy put a hole in with something sharp
make sure you get a grown-up to help you
with that and then cut out circle now it
doesn't have to be neat a talk you're
not going to see it it's just a little
hole so that your egg can sit nicely in
the top of it like that then we'll get
some paint I've got some nice yellowy
sandy colored paint and just paint all
over the egg box and then once you've
covered most of it leave it to dry now
for Humpty I'm going to start with his
stripey trouser so I've turned the egg
upside down so the fat bits at the
bottom and I'm just gonna draw a line
around it there that will be the top of
his trousers and I'm gonna join them
with a nice pair of stripy trousers
isn't a good way to do this is to sort
of draw a rainbow shape going up like
that you'll see when I paint it makes it
a lot easier then we'll do the same on
the other side so little rainbow shape
going up
okay and then I'm gonna get a much
thinner paint brush and I'm gonna paint
the white stripes first this is really
fun this better so I'm using acrylic
paints but you could just use normal
paints and mix a little bit of glue in
and that just makes it stick to the
eggshell a bit better and makes the
paint nice and shiny now you can see
he's got some lovely stripy trousers now
so we'll let him dry a little bit so
here's a dry egg and a dry wall I'm just
gonna put him there and give him a
little face at first of all I'm gonna
draw around the top of his trousers with
a pen just to make them stand out a
little bit more do that nice and slowly
and I'm going to give him a little
bowtie
and some eyes there we go lovely so I've
got my brown and blue card and the blue
card is gonna be his legs I'm just gonna
cut a long strip right up and then bend
it on back on itself over and over again
like this keep going you got a lovely
long bendy legs there we go then just
leave a bit to stick his feet on the end
and same again the other leg lovely legs
and then just gonna get my white pencil
and draw two little ovals like that they
can be his feet up you might want to get
a bit of help with the cutting out got
my glue stick glue on the end and then
stick the shoe on the other one
okay so I've got two legs there so I'll
just take Humpty out for a second and
then pop the legs in there and you can
just use a bit of glue to stick them if
you find they're a bit long so these are
tiny bit long just
stay there you want his legs to stick up
straight a nice comedy effect
now you have your Humpty Dumpty
